name: first meditation on nz water quality
description:
Waitakaruru river outlet, 2007 - 2020
-----
The Firth of Thames, near Auckland is a catchment area for much farming runoff from the Waikato. The ecology is complex but almost two centuries of exploitative logging and farming have created a fragile system while arguments about current land-based farming practice along with expanding aqua culture lead to overall degraded water quality.
-----
Using satellite map images in combination and modified, to investigate human impact on the Earth
